entry.title: Ripple CEO Condemns US SEC For Withdrawal From The Binance Lawsuit, Here’s Why
entry.summary:
In a scathing criticism, Brad Garlinghouse, the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of financial giant, Ripple, has publicly condemned the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) over its sudden retracement from the legal tussle with Binance, the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange.
The Ripple Chief in his criticism of the SEC’s strategy charged that the regulatory watchdog has been inconsistent and vague in its enforcement operations against leading digital assets platforms.
Ripple CEO Calls The US SEC Hypocrites
On Tuesday, the US SEC withdrew its request that the court categorize tokens such as Solana (SOL), Cardano (ADA), and Polygon (MATIC) as securities in the lawsuit against Binance, which the crypto community has considered a display of inconsistency and lack of …

entry.title: Today’s The Day? Pro-XRP Lawyer Discusses Potential Ripple-SEC Ruling
entry.summary:
Fred Rispoli, a prominent pro-XRP lawyer, has once again taken to X to reinforce his earlier prediction that today—July 31, 2024—would mark a significant turning point in the ongoing legal battle between Ripple Labs and the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Just yesterday, Rispoli posted, “I’m running out of time to hit my 7/31 prediction for the remedies ruling! #XRP”
Ripple-SEC Ruling Today?
The legal situation is notably complex. The proceedings are complicated by a pending motion. On April 29, Ripple submitted a “Motion to Strike” against new expert materials introduced by the SEC – declarations and exhibits from a new expert witness, Andrea Fox. This motion, still awaiting a decision from Judge Netburn, is pivotal as it could significantly influence the scope of remedie…

entry.title: Holding Bitcoin Has Been Profitable for 98.5% of Its Existence, Data Shows
entry.summary:
According to Bitcoin Magazine Pro data, holding Bitcoin has been profitable for 98.5% of its existence. The data reveals that out of the last 5,096 days since Bitcoin trading began, holding BTC has been profitable for 5,020 days relative to the current price of ~$66,500 per BTC. Since August 17, 2010, when Bitcoin was priced at just $0.07, its value has skyrocketed to around $66,500, representing an astounding increase of 94,999,900%. This consistent upward trajectory highlights Bitcoin's sustained growth and increasing adoption over time.
The chart from Bitcoin Magazine Pro underscores the aggressive growth of Bitcoin's adoption curve, driven by its limited supply of only 21 million BTC and ever increasing demand. This growth is a critical factor for investors to understand, as it demonstrates the potential long-term benefits of holding Bitcoin. However, it also emphasizes the importance of market cycle awareness, as buying during market cycle tops can lead to extended drawdowns, historically lasting 2-3 years. Though, this data counters the mainstream narrative that Bitcoin can be too risky for investors to buy and hold long-term. Instead, it demonstrates the significant rewards of long-term investment in Bitcoin, showcasing its use case as a reliable store of value. For those trying to calculate where the price of Bitcoin may trend towards in the future, this indicator shows how Bitcoin's value has accelerated as it gains global traction. As adoption and interest continue to rise, the percentage of profitable days is expected to increase and potentially surpass 99% in the future. For more detailed information, insights, and to sign up for a free trial to access Bitcoin Magazine Pro's data and analytics, visit the official website here.

entry.title: Lightning Network In A Class Of Its Own At Bitcoin 2024 Conference
entry.summary: I was asked repeatedly throughout this year’s Bitcoin 2024 conference what my highlight of the moment was — what the signal was amongst the noise. As I returned from Nashville, it occurred to me that, each time, I could never answer the question satisfyingly. In part, because I simply couldn’t keep up. The activity around the news desk and my support for those running the show left me with little time to focus on anything else. I can’t say I regret it. Anyone who gravitated around our livestream studio space during the week can attest to the energy surrounding it. The Bitcoin Magazine news desk was the veritable heartbeat of the conference. Now that I’ve had time to collect my thoughts, I can confidently say what stood out most from the conference was the understated presence of the Light…

entry.title: Beloved Kabosu Owner Gets New Shiba Inu Dog, Is This The Next Dogecoin?
entry.summary:
The crypto community might be set to witness the birth of the next Dogecoin following a recent announcement made by the beloved Kabosu’s owner. This has led to the launch of several meme coins, with one in particular looking well-primed to join the ‘billion-dollar’ club.
Kabosu’s Owner Gets New Shiba Inu Dog
Kabosu’s owner (also known as Kabosu Mama) announced in an X (formerly Twitter) post that she had gotten a new Shiba Inu named “Neiro.” This immediately caught the crypto community’s attention, considering that Kabosu, who passed away in May, inspired the creation of the foremost meme coin, Dogecoin, and several other dog-themed meme coins.
Similarly, Kabosu Mama’s announcement of her new Shiba Inu immediately led to the launch of several ‘Neiro-themed’ meme coins. Hundreds…

entry.title: Post Nashville Event Recap - A Bitcoin VC Perspective The Good, The Bad, and the Bullish
entry.summary: Macro - Crossing the Rubicon 1. Donald J. Trump and the point of no return. 3 words, “Strategic Bitcoin Stockpile”. It was theorized by many Bitcoiners for years, some would even say dreamed of, and it happened just last week. Fair to say that Bitcoin has indeed crossed some sort of Rubicon on Saturday, a point of no return where everything can suddenly accelerate. The culprit? - goes by the name of game theory. Nations around the world, from this day forward, have to take this idea of a Bitcoin reserve seriously or face the consequences of being left behind. If enacted, the US will own around 1% of the total bitcoin supply. From the perspective of other countries, this strategy would be tough to replicate as the US basically got this bitcoin for free (through what could most likely be co…

Phantom pauses cross-chain swaps amid exploit.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 159 - MEMECOINS GO MAD!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$301m. BTC dips from $65k as $6bn moves from Mt. Gox. Coinbase & MicroStrategy surge with BTC. Genesis sells another $38m BTC. ETH ETF timeline delayed until July 23rd. Trump chooses crypto friendly Vance as VP. Old clip shows Vance bashing Gensler on crypto. Bitcoin is good during debasement: Larry Fink. Michael Dell calls Fink video ‘fascinating’. Fear & Greed index shifts to Greed. Tether mints $1bn USDT on Tron. Stripe expands crypto integration to the EU.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 158 - A WILD WEEKEND FOR BITCOIN
entry.summary: Trump response optimism takes BTC to $63K. Bitcoin whales accumulate most since April 2023. Trump still set to talk at Bitcoin Nashville. ETH ETF approval this week: Geraci. XRP vs SEC press conference rumoured on 18th. Crypto funds saw $1.44B inflows last week. Rumours China is to ‘unban BTC’ in Q4. S. Korea may delay crypto taxes until 2028. Russia to allow crypto trading on stock exchange. All altcoin categories outperform BTC over 7d. BitConnect infamous promoter convicted. Scroll becomes 8th L2 with TVL over $1bn. ETHFI Season 2 claims available this week. Base hits record 1m UserOps in a week.

entry.title: Zoltan Istvan on AI and Human Immortality
entry.summary: Transhumanist Party founder Zoltan Istvan chats with Decrypt's Emerging Technology report Jason Nelson about his journey with transhumanism, running for office, and why he fears AI is outpacing life science and poses a threat to the quest for immortality.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 157 - ROLLBIT FRIDAY!
entry.summary: The German state sells $2bn+ BTC and has under $300m left. BTC ETF sees $800M of inflows, Mr 100 keeps buying. SOL ETF deadline set for 2025, election could be key. SOL stablecoin TVL soars on Tether & PYUSD growth. Firedancer sees the first accepted block on SOL testnet. ETH ETFs finally expected next week. Monthly active crypto addresses top 100m. Trump to speak at Bitcoin Nashville conference. Golman Sachs to launch 3 tokenization projects. Short squeeze in altcoins sees TIA rise 80% from lows. MOG leads top memes coins, BONK flips WIF. Farming interest shifts to Berachain & Monad.

entry.title: What's the Meta? Meet the Solana Dev Who Suffered Third Degree Burns to Pump a Token
entry.summary:
Meet Mikol: the Dare dev that doused himself in isopropyl alcohol and had fireworks shot at him. He instantly went up in flames and was rushed to hospital, where it became apparent he suffered third degree burns.
In this episode, Mikol reflects on the biggest night of his life, details his injuries, and the grueling recovery process he’s still in. Despite the traumatic incident, Mikol isn’t done with the project. Instead, he’s planning to build a decentralized app where community members can take on dares in exchange for DARE tokens.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 156 - ETH ON THE RISE!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: +$147m. ETH outperforms with ETF optimism. Germany government moves 2375 BTC again. Tether mints another $250m USDT on SOL. Trump to speak at Bitcoin Nashville. Goldman Sachs to launch 3 tokenisation projects. Realised losses similar to COVID period. Staked ETH nears ATH. CEX stablecoin volume hits 7-month low. CFTC says 70-80% of crypto not securities. Base hardfork improves compression 20-30%. BitMEX pleads guilty to AML violation. APTOS & SEI see weak attendance at ETHcc event.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 155 - ETFs SAVE THE DAY
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: $216m. $654m of inflows into ETFs over 3 days. BTC transaction fees hit 4-year low. German state moves $300m BTC, holdings $1bn. SOL flips ETH for 7d DEX volumes. SOL Firedancer sees first accepted block on testnet. Tether mints another $250m USDT on SOL. Crypto monthly active addresses tops 100m. Biden crypto veto now expected to be upheld. Tech coalition urges Biden to back crypto. People face security threats at ETHCC. DBS sees 300% growth in crypto trading. PYUSD now 7th largest stable coin. China may have already sold BTC holdings. Elliptic exposes $11bn USDT scam network. StanChart in talks to buy Howard’s crypto fund. Polychain accuses former employee of side deals. SEI leads altcoins as it launches v2 mainnet beta. TIA rises 80% from lows on short squeeze. TON to release L2 based on Polygon’s tech stack.
